author: JacobStruiksma
body:
If i try powershell remoting on windows, it is fine. If i try to use powershell remoting from a linux machine to a linux machine, and the sshd has a banner defined in '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'(at the destination side) it fails to connect to the other linux machine.

Maybe it is the same issue as #5142, but it does not mention that this fails only on linux to linux remote powershell connections.

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
PS /home/user> Enter-PSSession -HostName 'linuxmachine' -UserName 'user'
```

# Expected behavior
```powershell
PS /home/user> Enter-PSSession -HostName 'linuxmachine' -UserName 'user'
user@linuxmachine's password:
[user@linuxmachine]: PS /home/user>
```

# Actual behavior

```powershell
PS /home/user> Enter-PSSession -HostName 'linuxmachine' -UserName 'user'
user@linuxmachine's password: Enter-PSSession: The background process reported an error with the following message: The SSH client session has ended with error message: ###
# banner
###.
```

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0
OS                             Linux 4.19.97-v7+ #1294 SMP Thu Jan 30 13:15:58 GMT 2020
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
